Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer has taken the time to tell USA Today's Maria Bartiromo that his company is basically great and the Xbox 360 isn't a games console. Steve Ballmer tells the fragrant Ms Maria Bartiromo that Xbox isn't a gaming console. Xbox is a family entertainment center. It's a place to socialize. It's a place to watch TV. We have Hulu coming. It's the only system where you are the controller. Your voice, your gestures, your body. He doesn't stop there though. Saying his "heart was in Indiana," Mike Pence said he would continue to meet with the good and strong and opinionated people of this state before deciding his next move. During a question-and-answer session, Mike Pence said his proudest moment as a congressman came when he helped a Muncie mother avoid deportation to her home country of Sierra Leone.

said David Letterman . "Being pummeled?" Anderson Cooper said. "I don't recommend it. I'd never been hit in the head before." He described the scene, saying, People came from all around, surrounding us, punching us, kicking us, trying to rip the clothes off my female producer. It was weird. And we were lucky, frankly.... I would start to slap back and then realize this is going to make it worse. My adrenline was pumping so much. I've never really been in a fight like this or attacked by a mob like this.
